data.text:
Ethiopian has resumed weekly passenger services to Enugu, Nigeria. Ethiopian is one of the oldest carriers flying to Nigeria serving the country since 1960, strengthening trade, cultural and tourism ties between Nigeria and the rest of the world.

data.text: Ethiopian was the first African airline to order the Boeing 767, with delivery in early 1980s. By now, these aircraft types are set to be converted to a dedicated cargo freighter at the Ethiopian MRO at Addis. https://t.co/ekKerKHFQM
